entry.title: Shared Storage: Add browser tests for image attribute
entry.content:
We add browser for our implementation of writing to

shared storage from the new `HTMLImageElement` IDL/content attribute

`sharedStorageWritable`/`sharedstoragewritable`.



This is part of a project to add support to writing to shared storage

from response headers. See

https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/70 for more information

and https://crrev.com/c/4691573 for a prototype for adding image

and iframe attributes.

entry.title: crosapi: Abort browser actions when Lacros is shutting down
entry.content:
When BrowserServiceLacros processes a request from Ash, Lacros may

already be shutting down. This has caused assertion failures in the

wild.



Make BrowserServiceLacros check if a shutdown is in progress and,

if so, cancel the request via the mojo callback. For this, add a new

CreationResult enum value kBrowserShutdown and add the CreationResult

callback parameter in some places that didn't have it.



Bug: chromium:1455567

entry.title: [Reauth] Add metric logging for reauth usage during checkout
entry.content:
We introduce a new metric to get the reauth usage conversion rate

(started/failed/succeeded) for each CardType (local/virtual card) +

AuthenticationMethod (biometric/screen lock).



In order to log this:

1. Introduce a new enum AuthenticationMethod and new interface

GetAuthenticationMethod in MandatoryReauthManager (which calls

device_authenticator to get the authentication type), so that

access_manager can get the authentication method breakdown.

2. Add authentication_method to the existing

OnDeviceAuthenticationResponseForFilling in order to pass through the

auth method for logging when reauth fails/succeeds.

3. Introduce a new LogMandatoryReauthCheckoutFlowUsageEvent in metric

util class, it reuse the existing MandatoryReauthAuthenticationFlowEvent event enum



Bug: 1473173

Change-Id: I5a434c3c8e067beb4bc3591b3be2f2dcc1cc2a25

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4754503

Reviewed-by: Stephen McGruer

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Add fields to mark Launcher/Shelf items as promise apps
entry.content:
Add attributes that allow us to identify which items in the Launcher and

Shelf represent promise apps:

* In the Launcher, we add the IsPromiseApp() method which checks whether

the item type is AppServicePromiseAppItem.

* In the Shelf, we add the is_promise_app field to ShelfItem, which we

set when we create the ShelfItem.



These changes will make it easier to determine which items to add a UI

progress overlay effect on.

entry.title: [wpt-importer] Detect new import failures from WPT metadata
entry.content:
Add importer functionality to parse changed metadata files and read the

expectations to find new failing tests it should file bugs for. Each

failure will add a line in the bug description that links to the

imported patch (similar to baselines):

test.html new failing tests: https://crrev.com/1/1/test.html.ini



A test is considered to have a new failure if, for any test

configuration, any (sub)test has a new non-default status (e.g., FAIL to

[FAIL, OK], and vice versa, is not considered a new failure).



For now, only generate failures from metadata for `wdspec` tests, which

effectively switched to wptrunner in crrev.com/c/4723147. Other test

types will continue relying on *-expected.txt and TestExpectations for

failure detection.

entry.title: [rust] Breakpad: demangle Rust symbols
entry.content:
Chromium now includes Rust code, and we need to be able to demangle Rust

symbols. This adds the appropriate support to breakpad.



The primary customer for this change will be the internal service by

which we look at Chrome crash reports. That uses a separate copy of

this breakpad code built elsewhere, but in fact we don't need to

modify that copy. Instead, the symbols are dumped and demangled using

the breakpad tooling within the Chromium checkout, and thus this is the

copy where it matters.



This also happens to be the first time we've used a third-party Rust

crate build as a dynamic library, so a few small tooling tweaks were

necessary to make that work properly. Specifically, we're overriding

the decision of such crates to be cdylibs, and building them as rlibs

instead, thus allowing us to use the existing C++ linker commands

to assemble final binaries.



Bug: 1292052

Change-Id: Ic12fc30a9d1ed1bb3b30223b632eb787cb7d7790

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4755935

entry.title: [p2p] Fix dangling pointers access in 'SocketUdp'
entry.content:
The 'SocketUdp' is silently deconstructed if a non-transient error

occurs. This can lead to dangling pointer access if the object is still

referenced after it has been deconstructed.



This CL addresses the potential dangling pointer issue by ensuring that

the object is not accessed if 'HandleReadResult()' returns False.

entry.title: Nintendo Switch gamepads: don't turn on home light
entry.content:
When a Nintendo Switch gamepad is initialized on Chromium, the home light

of the gamepad is turned on, and never turns off. However, on the actual

Nintendo Switch console, the home light's purpose is to signal to the

user that there are notifications: it isn't meant to be turned on all

the time, as it is distracting and annoying.



With this change, Chromium won't automatically turn on the home light

anymore. This is also consistent with other programs for using these

gamepads on PC, like SDL.



Bug: 1473003

Change-Id: I05c0ff5638838126415a1ba256280b22c97e7c03

entry.title: Change a way the printer is set up when viewing PPD file
entry.content:
This patch changes the method that is used to set a printer up when the

user wants to see the printer's PPD file. In the previous version, the

method ash::printing::SetUpPrinter() is used for setting the printer up.

Unfortunately, this method was designed to be called from PrintPreview

only. This patch solves this problem by calling SetUpPrinter() directly

from CupsPrintersManager.

maintain.



Performance is neutral on desktop and android.

entry.title: Introduce CompressionDictionaryTransportEnabled policy
entry.content:
By disabling this policy, administrators can disable the Compression

Dictionary Transport feature. This is useful when they are using

firewalls which are decrypting TLS traffic using a private interception

certificate, because this feature may have interoperability issues with

such firewalls.

entry.title: fido/mac: don't erase the userHandle from assertion responses
entry.content:
CTAP2 security keys will not return a userHandle for assertion responses

generated without UV in order to limit possible disclosure of PII to

unauthorized users, e.g. if the key is lost or stolen. But that is

purely a CTAP rule, so WebAuthn platform authenticators aren't bound by

it. And the PII disclosure concern doesn't really apply there anyway,

because the user getting a platform authenticator assertion must have

access to the unlocked device.



Fixed: 1472210

entry.title: multi_display: No bounds update for snapped window in ReparentWindow
entry.content:
Do not set bounds directly for snapped windows while doing

ReparentWindow. As it will be handled by the layout manager instead.



There was no bounds update for snapped windows at the beginning

while introducing the logic, see codereview.chromium.org/93873013.



It should not change the logic while removing a function,

see codereview.chromium.org/169713003. Update bounds for snapped

windows was introduced in this cl, but actually it should not happen.



Further handling of the snapped windows while moving to another display

can be found at codereview.chromium.org/134643018.

entry.title: Deflake PDF extension printing tests
entry.content:
Some tests based on PDFExtensionPrintingTest have been only waiting for

the OnPrintNow() observation before exiting. This results in a race

condition between an active print job and the test framework shutdown

logic. At times this could result in incorrectly destroying a print

job that is still pending.



Remove this race by making the test wait longer, until the print job

has been released before allowing the test to exit. This should remove

the flakiness around these tests.



Low-Coverage-Reason: https://crbug.com/1473107

Bug: 1472464

Change-Id: Ic0fddff36ef24422fb712995709f282de56b2a5a

entry.title: [SBv5] Add new threat source ANDROID_SAFEBROWSING_REAL_TIME
entry.content:
This involves changes to the following:

- Return ANDROID_SAFEBROWSING_REAL_TIME as the threat source in

RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager if the check type is HashRealTime.

- CSBRRs have a new url_api_type ANDROID_SAFEBROWSING_REAL_TIME

- Hit reports have a new threat source URL parameter "asbrt"

- New SafeBrowsingMetricsCollector EventType

ANDROID_SAFEBROWSING_REAL_TIME_INTERSTITIAL_BYPASS. This affects

existing histograms SafeBrowsing.EsbDisabled.LastBypassEventType and

SafeBrowsing.Daily.BypassCountLast28Days.{UserState}.AllEvents.

- Add new histogram suffix to interstitial histograms such as

interstitial.phishing.decision.from_android_safebrowsing_real_time.



We discussed whether we need a new event type and histogram suffix for

Android, or if we can reuse the ones introduced for desktop

(https://crrev.com/c/4615748). The value for desktop doesn't account

for HPD fallback, so we decided to not reuse the value on Android.

See the discussion in go/chrome-hprt-logging.



Server-side CL for proto changes: http://cl/556118935.

entry.title: Only set OverlayCandidate::rounded_corners when required
entry.content:
When delegated compositing is enabled (eg lacros), rounded corners

data (gfx::RRectF) were being unconditionally set to all

OverlayCandidate instances, despite whether it'd be effectively applied

on Ash side or not.

At very least, this increases the data traffic between lacros and exo

and adds up some extra processing on both client and server sides.



This CL optimizes that verifying whether any of the rounded corners

bounding rects (up/left, up/right, down/left, down/right) intersect

with the respective OverlayCandidate::display_rect.



R=petermcneeley@chromium.org



Bug: 1462171

entry.title: Use D3D11VideoDecoder 11.0 on Windows QualComm devices
entry.content:
When using D3D11 VDA on Windows QC ARM64 chipsets 8180+ w/ clear

content the Video Decoder will encounter an E_INVALIDARG when

attempting to call ID3D11VideoContext1::SubmitDecoderBuffer1.



This change uses the existing limit_d3d11_video_decoder_to_11_0 gpu

workaround to force the use of

ID3D11VideoContext::SubmitDecoderBuffer which works on these

chipsets.



Since this impacts most shipping Windows ARM devices I've setup the

blocklist entry to target the QC vendor id (0x5143) until there is a

set of drivers with a fix.



Bug: 1471637

entry.title: Add support for Shared Zstd
entry.content:
This CL adds the "zstd-d" token to Accept-Encoding when Compression

Dictionary Transport is enabled and the SharedZstd flag is enabled.

It also adds support for decompressing with Shared Zstd when

Content-Encoding is "zstd-d".



This CL also introduces CreateZstdSourceStreamWithDictionary() which

calls ZSTD_DCtx_loadDictionary_advanced() to use the dictionary.

entry.title: [Extensions] Add a mojom struct for ServiceWorkerContext
entry.content:
Add a mojom struct representing a ServiceWorkerContext that includes

service worker scope URL, service worker version ID, and worker

thread ID, and use this struct when registering service worker-related

listeners in the EventRouter.



This reduces the number of parameters to these IPC messages and obviates

the need for the internal ServiceWorkerIdentifier struct in EventRouter.



This CL has no behavior change.

entry.title: Fix off center home button focus ring
entry.content:
Stop centering the home button's focus ring, because centering it while

the quick app is shown can cause it to be placed incorrectly.



Stop setting a rounded corner radius on the HomeButton's layer,

this is no longer needed as the home button is already drawn circular

and it caused clipping on the HomeButton's focus ring. Update pixel

tests because this causes some very small aliasing changes on the edges of the home button.



Finally, add a correctly colored rounded focus ring to the quick app

button which can appear next to the home button.

entry.title: Introduce @view-transitions
entry.content:
This is an initial implementation of the new @view-transitions at-rule,

primarily discussed on this CSSWG issue:



https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/8048



This CL implements an @view-transitions rule with a single descriptor,

`navigation-trigger`, taking two values: `cross-document-same-origin`,

`none`. e.g.



@view-transitions {

navigation-trigger: cross-document-same-origin;

}



There's lots still to do:



* Make it cascade correctly

* Flesh out CSSOM interface

* Make it work from UA stylesheets

* Remove the existing opt-in



These will be done as followups.



Bug: 1463966

Change-Id: I922bb409326497352de3eebac2e6e2fb68736db9

entry.title: Extensions: WFH: Confirmation dialog for first-time extension file opens
entry.content:
Present a confirmation dialog before opening any of the

extension declared file types for the first time if the extension isnâ€™t

part of the OS (operating system) (or in an allowlist). `Remember my

choice` applies to any declared file type associated with an extension.



In order to "remove extensive business logic from app_service" while

taking advantage of all of the downstream app_service code that helps to

launch apps such as WFH (Web File Handlers), the following flow has been

implemented: app_service:: asks extensions:: if it should ask ui:: for

permissions. If not, app_service:: resumes, otherwise it's halted until

the inquiry is complete. See the attached video demo.



Reuse several parts of the UI where it made sense, such as ensuring that

every file extension is present, instead of just one. If remember is

selected, it is one and done for the entire extension, instead of trying

to manage every single file extension. This CL started out that way, but

the complexity involved in managing every permutation wasn't worth it,

especially given that there is already a prior flow that show each, too.



Demo:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lHchig6_Ubsytki8cfhvlBNTaXk09e4V



UI:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1h7ZjryB2zYEjUG9DqPLzAM1iSUXr8ZadUUY02ycExAQ



Design:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WTdCYscS5t7bHLyxA1MZ0z8XTmCt8XaIzEBd4sI2lOI



Bug: chromium:1448893

entry.title: [Nearby] Add LocalCredential mojom conversion and converter methods.
entry.content:
Added a mojo struct to represent PrivateKey and LocalCredential

from the Nearby API. Added methods to convert from between

proto and mojo struct representations, to enable protos to be

passed through mojo interface calls.



Nearby Presence's credential storage API implementation,

which lives in //chromeos/ash, calls upon methods in

the NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage interface. The

implementation for this interface lives in //chrome/services.

To facilitate passing LocalCredential and PrivateKeys protos

to be saved by the implementation of the

NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage interface, this CL adds

methods to convert their Proto types to Mojo types.



In future, these methods and types will be separated to

its own build target at

.../nearby/presence/conversions/proto_conversions.h

to be shared as a dependency for the two afformentioned

implementations.



Test: Added new unit tests for each new method.

Bug: b:287334195

Change-Id: Ie12a78febb9802ae7448488bac81e8c5170ff35a

entry.title: media: Add DecoderBufferSideData
entry.content:
This adds a formalized side data struct to media::DecoderBuffer and

removes existing usages of the raw array for side data.



There are two existing cases of side data and this CL also adds a

third new one. The two existing ones are for VP9 spatial layers and

alpha data. The new one is for a secure handle which is used for

secure world content decryption on ARM in ChromeOS.



This also removes some TextRenderer support since that is deprecated

and will be removed. Changes made here break some of the functionality

so the unit test for it is removed as well.



In order to deal with Lacros compatibility, this does translate

between the existing raw data format and the new formalized format and

vice-versa. At M120, the corresponding code for that should be removed.



BUG=b:248610722,b:269383891,1471504

TEST=CQ



Change-Id: I0f90c3417fcd72bb25738ca045e527fbc1371ab7

entry.title: Ensure WebGPU canvas texture nextInChain is null
entry.content:
Some WebGPU CTS runs were hitting a DCHECK in webgpu_swap_chain_provider

that ensured the texture descriptors nextInChain was null. Because we

have both an internal and external texture on some devices that don't

support all required canvas formats, the descriptor could sometimes have

a nextInChain added by a previous configure() call that wasn't cleared

during a subsequent one.



This change ensures that we start with a completely zeroed out texture

descriptor every time.



Bug: dawn:1970

Change-Id: Id1f55d990964a05cfe3555f94f3a6ee1d3376aee

entry.title: [Omnibox] Make sAvoidRelayoutDuringFocusAnimation default true
entry.content:
The default of the feature is true, so we should default to true

pre-native. This might cause issues in rare cases for the disabled

group, but the enabled group matters more since the disabled group is

only for holdback purposes.

entry.title: Passthrough: Pass UseCmdDecoder flag to renderer for bots
entry.content:
Pass the UseCmdDecoder switch needed for selecting the correct command

decoder to use when running CQ bots based on new feature config.

This is already passed for the gpu_process_host but not for renderer.

This change updates the render_process_host_impl so that the switch can

be used for checking multiplanar shared images feature enabled for

tests that currently override this command line flag.

entry.title: Replace add eSim button with add eSim entry for QsRevamp
entry.content:
This CL replaced the add eSim button in the mobile header with add eSim

entry at the bottom of the mobile section. This entry row will show up

only under the conditions that the previous eSim button is enabled and

visible. If there's no mobile network set up and the eSim entry is

visible, the "No mobile devices set up" message will not show while the

add eSim entry is showing. This CL also modifies the unit tests to be

compatible with this new entry.

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7K6iLLH9fVXTgmk
